p: EO vapors influenced also carotenoid content preserving the amount of these antioxidant compounds in fumigated fruit. Generally, carotenoids decrease during storage. They are photo- and heat-sensitive and tend to oxidize if they are not protected from light and atmosphere [ 46]. In nectarines, only untreated control and fruit treated with savory EO at 1% showed a significant decrease in total carotenoid content during storage, while carotenoid amounts remained stable in the other fumigated fruit ( Figure 3).
